questions.question_text: Which mobile app allows the user to conduct an inventory audit?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Audit your asset inventory
Requirements:
Hardware Asset Management
ServiceNow Agent mobile app
Role required: asset

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/hardware-asset-management/task/audit-asset-inventory.html

Selected Answer: A
Answer: A. ServiceNow Agent mobile app

Explanation: "Use the ServiceNow Mobile app to view the assets that are assigned to you, to report any issues with your assets, and to remotely receive new assets. Create incidents to report any issues with your assets to your IT department."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/now-mobile-asset.html

Selected Answer: A
A
Requirements:
Hardware Asset Management
ServiceNow Agent mobile app
Role required: asset
A is the correct answer. ServiceNow Agent Mobile App

questions.question_text: When running an asset audit, you receive the result of 10 "Scanned and expected" assets. What does this mean?

choices.C: You expected 10 assets during your audit inventory and scanned 10 assets, but none of them have a record in your ServiceNow instance.
choices.A: You expected 10 assets in your inventory and scanned 10 assets during your audit, but none of them are on your expected inventory list.
choices.B: You expected 10 assets in your inventory and scanned these 10 assets during your audit.
choices.D: You scanned 10 assets in your inventory, but none of them were on your expected inventory list.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. You expected 10 assets in your inventory and scanned these 10 assets during your audit.

Selected Answer: B
You expected 10 assets in your inventory and scanned these 10 assets during your audit.

Selected Answer: B
Scanned and expected: Number of expected assets that were scanned.

Selected Answer: C
Expected Assets â€“ shows all assets that are assigned to the stockroom or location that is being audited. (Again, the list is not populated until scanning begins.)

Selected Answer: C
C is correct List does not populate till first scan to improve accuracy.

Ans C
The expected assets list is not populated until the scanning begins

questions.question_text: During an audit, when is the Expected Assets list populated in the asset audit form?

choices.E: When the asset manager Submits the results
choices.D: Pre-populated by the asset manager before audit
choices.A: When the nightly scheduled job runs

questions.question_text: Which of the following are valid substates of the Retired state? (Choose four.)

discussion.content: Its ABCF

Selected Answer: ABCE
It's A, B, C, E AND F - tested on my demo instance.
Other valid retirement substates include: Lease Return, Obsolete, RMA and Buy Out

Selected Answer: ABCF
ABCF
module 2. Trustworthy Data / Asset Data / Assets

Selected Answer: ABCF
From HAM Fundamentals (Vancouver) page 239:

When retiring an asset, it is important to indicate what became of the asset. ServiceNow includes default retirement Substates that meet the needs of most customers:

Disposed
Sold
Donated
Vendor credit

Selected Answer: ABCF
The options ABCF are listed as Substates for Retired state in the HAM Fundamentals > Asset Retirement > Asset States and Substates

comments.content: E. Pending Disposal is listed too!

From Now Learning, in the path marka_1267 mentioned above:
Why is selecting a substate important?
When retiring an asset, it is important to indicate what became of the asset. ServiceNow includes default retirement Substates that meet the needs of most customers:

Disposed
Sold
Donated
Vendor credit

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABCE
ABCEF, 5 answers are correct, not 4. Checked on Learning instance as well

Selected Answer: ABCF
Disposed, Sold, Donated & Vendor Credit
ABCEF - correct

Selected Answer: ABCE
abcef are correct
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/task/t_SettingAssetStatesAndSubstates.html

Selected Answer: ABCE
Destroyed is not a substate.

in the book it's ABCF p71 but on Product Doc it's ABCEF lol
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/task/t_SettingAssetStatesAndSubstates.html

Selected Answer: ABCF
Disposed, Sold, Donated and Vendor Credit

Selected Answer: ABCE
Destroyed is not a substate. Answer is ABCE and F (sold)

questions.question_text: What is the third tier of the capability blueprint?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It's in several places in the book (Vancouver), but page 22 is one example.

Selected Answer: D
1. Trustworthy Data: Know what you have so you can manage your assets.
2. Practical Management: Improve management controls and drive immediate benefits.
3. Operational Integration: Improve efficiency and effectiveness through integration with other areas, such as request, procurement, and IT Service Management.
4. Strategic Conformance: Achieve best in-class.

Selected Answer: D
CORRECT
D is correct

Tier 1 â€“ Trustworthy Data
Know what you have, so you can manage your assets.
Tier 2 â€“ Practical Management
Improve management controls and drive immediate benefits.
Tier 3 â€“ Operational Integration
Improve efficiency and effectiveness through integration with other process such as request procurement.
Tier 4 â€“ Strategic Conformance
Achieve best in-class.
